text: Grady Gaines (May 14, 1934 â€“ January 29, 2021) was an American electric and jazz blues tenor saxophonist. He performed and recorded with Little Richard in the 1950s. He played with other musicians such as Dee Clark, Little Willie John, Sam Cooke, James Brown, Jackie Wilson, and Joe Tex. He released three albums. Gaines died on January 29, 2021 in Houston at the age of 86. ==References== ==Other websites== *Grady Gaines Interview - NAMM Oral History Library (2015) * Grady Gaines & the Texas Upsetters at gulfcoastentertainment.com Category:1934 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American saxophonists Category:American blues musicians Category:Musicians from Houston
title: Grady Gaines
